cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate north-northeast today and then turn northeast, aiming for the Florida Big Bend and crossing the peninsula into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (roughly Cedar Key to Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River northward to Indian Pass; Tropical Storm Watch from Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Anclote River to the Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Gulf coast from Bonita Beach northward through the Big Bend, then coastal GA/SC/NC later in week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Thursday into early Friday, highest chance ~30%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible in Tampa Bay including Port Manatee’s berth areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain possible, locally higher, creating flash-flood and drainage issues on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Thursday night; lightning, squalls, and reduced visibility likely during heavy rain bands.
